Description: Lid of a polychrome painted cartonnage mummy-case for the body of Petobastis; face gilded and wig painted, depicted wearing a collar and bead-net (?), with representation of Nut, with outstretched wings, on breast with falcon of Horus beneath. Demotic inscription in top border of leg placard.
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 63 [34]. Riggs, Beautiful Burial in Roman Egypt (2005): 62, 63, 65, 66, 67, 83, 85, 87, 88, 265; 247 n. 6
Published in S. P. Vleeming, Demotic and Greek-Demotic Mummy Labels and Other Short texts gathered from Many Publications (Studia Demotica 9; Leuven: Peeters), no. 1077.
Bibliographic references: Parlasca & Seeman 1999 / Augenblicke. Mumienporträts und ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit (p.285, no.185)
Riggs 2005 / Beautiful burial in Roman Egypt (no.26)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
